subject: Law
title: What Makes Something a Crime
description: One-minute skill: What Makes Something a Crime.

hook.text: Lying is wrong, but it's not always a crime. Lying under oath is. The difference is what the law prohibits.

buildup.text: A crime is an act that violates a law enacted by a legislature and is punishable by the state.

climax.text: Legislatures define crimes. Prosecutors charge them. Courts interpret them. The process has many gatekeepers.

punchline.text: No law, no crime. That's the bedrock principle.
